io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.aem.integration

Interface RhymeResourceRegistration


  • @ConsumerType
public interface RhymeResourceRegistration
    An SPI interface that needs to be implemented as an OSGi Component in your service bundle. It is required for the Rhyme AEM integration to know how to find the right resource implementation based on the selector of the incoming request, and will also render all links to these resource classes with the appropriate selector.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Optional<? extends io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api.resources.LinkableResource> getApiEntryPoint(SlingResourceAdapter adapter)
      Returns an instance of the resource that should be linked from the global API discovery entry point of the Rhyme AEM integration.

    • Method Detail

      • getModelClassesWithSelectors

        Map<Class<? extends io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api.resources.LinkableResource>,String> getModelClassesWithSelectors()
        Lists all linkable resource implementation classes (e.g. sling models) defined in your bundle, and defines the Sling selectors to be used in the links to these resources
        Returns:
        a Map with resource implementation classes as keys, and the corresponding selectors as values

      • getApiEntryPoint

        Optional<? extends io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api.resources.LinkableResource> getApiEntryPoint(SlingResourceAdapter adapter)
        Returns an instance of the resource that should be linked from the global API discovery entry point of the Rhyme AEM integration. Your API should have one entry point that allows to access / discover all other resources. If you return an instance of this entry point in this method, it will be linked within the resource located at the /content.rhyme path.
        Parameters:
        adapter - for the incoming request that can be used to create and initialize the sling model implementation of your entry point resource
        Returns:
        an optional providing the instance of the entry point resource (or empty if your API shouldn't be discoverable)
